This series is a spectacle in the shounen genre. Let us not mince words!! This show succeeds in utilizing its cast of secondary characters due to a long episode count and filler episode budget that the animation studio has. Battle sequences are epic where new abilities need to be learned for our main character to keep up with the looming threats wanting to destroy the shinobi world. The villains in Naruto are very fleshed out. Naruto Shippuuden gets you invested in the main characters and rooting for them quickly into the first Akatsuki onslaught. The filler episodes fall into the "hit-or-miss" category, so if you are watching for the story or over-the-top shounen fights, you might wanna have a list of filler episodes ready so that you can accelerate thru the long episode count. I don't suggest marathoning such a long-running shounen; save your sanity. But this shounen is worth the watch!!

Let me start this review by saying I've seen every episode that has been aired for both Naruto (completed) and Naruto Shippuden (currently) and yes that also includes fillers. *Now I understand that not everyone is going to have the same opinion as me but the entire Naruto franchise will always have a dear place in my heart and here's why: Story: The story line for Naruto Shippuden is a lot different from Naruto, but it is equally great. Once you get past the infinite amount of filler, or decide to skip them, it is clear that although Sasuke's retrieval makes up most of the adventures, there is just SO MUCH MORE to follow along with. Naruto Shippuden can have you crying, laughing, stressed and angry all in the course of one episode. Characters: My oh my how they have changed. All of the characters have grown so much and even Kiba is likable haha. Here are two examples: Naruto came back a whole new person. Literally. His outfit is upgraded, his maturity has somewhat increased, and so has his height ;) Sakura: one of my favorite characters is clearly no longer "useless". I love her but I have to admit, she did not have much to contribute to Part 1 but now... If you haven't caught up to at least episode 400, your in for a treat! Overall Naruto and Naruto Shippuden, the movies, the manga, everything is 100% enjoyable and if you decide to stick with it to the end, you'll be in for a treat

An anime I was very fond of, which I could label myself a true FAN (which is rare to me) but that I unfortunately felt forced to drop. The reason: Way too many many many fillers, plus the way that Sasuke guys suck lemons with his arrogant attitude and demeanor, and how Naruto won't just give up the prick. This turned this anime I really liked into something unwatchable in only 95 episodes. I lost my patience when they came up with that Doton/Crystal element arc. I mean, fillers are fillers, but Shipuuden's are hard to get through, they're too bad to watch from start to finish. Plus, even if it didn't have fillers, the story drags itself, the pace is soooooo slow, makes me think Kishimoto doesn't respect the fans. This is at most a mediocre show.

this is an awesome anime, especially if you liked the original naruto. anyways, you cant watch the first naruto series without seeing this one, because it would be incomplete! the only thing i absolutely dislike is THE FILLERS!! but i bear them, and continue on with the story. hope you like!

It's a boring show and I couldn't even stand watching it anymore. I don't read the manga, so I won't be comparing it to the manga. Up until the Pain arc ended the show was great (I would of gave a 8 overall) except for boring filler episodes, but once the Konoha past filler ended it went straight down hill. It started becoming some bad emotional drama. Every second a flashback would occur showing some scene involving Naruto and Sasuke playing the SAME song every time. I mean 2 non-filler episodes were literally 18 minutes of flashbacks showing the same flashbacks they played the last 10 episodes. I can't stand the silly plot anymore and if flashbacks are not happening it's the same thing reoccurring. All the Hokages 'WAR' let's go tell the feudal lords 'WAR' let's let all the people know 'WAR' that took 20 episodes LONG. There was no plot development what-so-ever. I plan to continue the show once the war actually begins.

I personally feel that this anime is one of the best I've watched, due to the darker atmosphere it gives compared to the original Naruto and the addictive nature of the plot. Definitely worth watching. P.s Other reviews seems so pedantic and picky towards the anime; this anime is completely worth watching. Enjoy it and stop complaining, people.

this will be short and sweet. I don't write reviews but naruto having so many 10's really gets to me. The overlaying story is very well done(for the most part). the art, i like(unlike some younger people used to way different quality). Sound is on point. Unique and impactful. That being said, everything else about the show is mediocre at best. The characters advance, but done actually DEVELOP, with the exception of naruto and sasuke(i'll give you shikimaru as well i suppose). Sakura learns to fight, and then barely does. everyone else has basically a static personality that may change a little bit, but then goes back to as it was. This show, along with bleach, are what i call failed potential. Great premises, could go so far, but seems to fall short due to filler and mediocre character development. I will say the show is enjoyable, but come prepared with a filler guide and if your anything like me, u can watch naruto and around 100 episodes of shippuden before you feel it's worth watching. as for me it was the first death involving an akatsuki attack(if you've watched, you know who) that finally made the show seem to have some form of realism and depth and frankly it shouldnt have taken that long. If a 12 episode anime with a crappy story can make me cry, why did it 300+ for shippuden to illicit a similar response? If you read this, thank you and i encourage you to watch the show, as it lasted for a reason, even if i feel it fell short of its mark.

Just over one year after starting the original Naruto series, I have gotten through all 770 episodes. Although I did not get to experience it in the way many others did by growing up with it through the many years of its airing, in a way I lucked out because I did not have to spend months watching weekly fillers. I personally believe reviews/ratings by people who watch a show later after it has aired are a lot more reliable than ones that are given immediately after a show finishes airing. Peoples expectations and bias towards a show often cloud the reliability of a seasonal show's rating, especially when its a preliminary rating (no idea why people rate shows before completing them). But thats beside the point. Naruto is arguable one of the most entertaining series not just in anime, but in entertainment ever. Its ability to captivate an audience and blow them away was put on display numerous times. Whether it was the opening arc of the Land of Waves, the Chunin Exam, or Pains Arc, it told its story in such an interesting and fun way. Even though Naruto isnt exactly known for its complex plot or characters, theres really no anime that comes close to it in excitement. Fillers suck, yea we get it, try to go a day without complaining about the Naruto fillers challenge (most of you would fail). Naruto Shippuden has some quality filler arcs compared to the original series, particularly towards the last half of the show. Great filler arcs that come to mind are the Kakashi, Itachi, and Kaguya background ones. If people would look at filler as extra content instead of waste of time, then they would be able to enjoy it a lot more. Its like DLC!!! Damn... the characters in Naruto Shippuden... are something else. Pretty much every main Uchiha character is awesome, along with Team 7, the Kage, and some of the Konan kids. Naruto's character is the highlight of well, the Naruto series. His character isnt exactly complex. He doesnt go through much character "development" per say. But watching his story, and his dream, play out its hard to put into words the feelings you get from that. Hes such a bright, uplifting character and it makes viewers so happy to see everyone around him not only acknowledge him, but follow behind him as their leader. Focusing on the bright side of an anime series is what people in this community should always do. You can critique Naruto for its many filler arcs, or for not putting lots of effort into animation. But the show is still the most popular and impactful anime of all time for a reason. It has that IT factor that makes people of all ages want to watch it. No other show will ever be able to do what the Naruto franchise has done, and hopefully nobody tries. The thrill and hype moments Naruto brings are forever cementing in Anime history.

Naruto shippuden or called filleruto, was great at the start, then fillers ruined it like crazzy!!! the arc now has been going on since 2013, and the latest 20 episodes have all been fillers, i dont understand whats going on? oh well, shippuden takes place 3 years after the first naruto anime, everyone you saw in the original anime has grown up, the characters in the start are really not that great, exept the main enemy group, later characters become better but are still one dimentional, like the animation, shippuden it feels like have gone threw so many diffrent animations, sometimes it looks good, sometimes awfull, right now its fair, one fight scene with naruto and a main enemy has the aboslute worst animation i have ever seen in an anime, i mean wtf. Sound is really good tho and it has great intros and outros, naruto tho is the most typical shounen there is so dont expect, one punch man animation or , death note storytelling! The characters that are good are really good! like itachi uchia, sasuke uchia, naruto altho he can be annyoing sometimes, and the enemys in the hole show are some of the best ive seen in an shounene anime, overall 9/10 without fillers, but now its filleruto so 7/10

I said I was gonna go to bed but I lied.....I'm not gonna write much as I know some people have a serious problem with naruto and I can totally understand why. Instead of grading Naruto Im gonna just do The good, The bad, and The Ugly. "Your doing something different? Thats so stupid and wiierd. Why would you do that?" It's simpler, faster, easier, and because f**k you, thats why. THE GOOD: Story has a very fun and interesting premise with tons of action, superpowers, ninjas, respect, badass fight and much more. The story is so long and complex it really has some great plot twists that are a pleasure to watch even if you know it's going to happen 50 episodes before it happens (because most of us read the manga). The characters are awesome and you become attached to them the more you watch. They all have flaws, they all have personality, and they all have history. It all ties together quite nicely over the years since this anime began. THE BAD: This is strictly my opinion so feel free to completely disregard this section and go onto the next because I know for a fact that alot of people will not agree with what Im about to say. It didnt have enough romance, there I said it. I think there could have been a few places where romance could have boosted this anime up to around an 8.4ish score. Once again I dont expect people to agree with this so please disregard this section if you disagree. I would actually appreciate a personal message telling me what you think about this whether its good or bad. Im very interested on what you guys have to say about this topic and upcoming movie. Anyway, moving on. THE UGLY: Im pretty sure you all know what I'm goin to say...and yes you are right....FILLERS. Now dont get me wrong. I grew up with Naruto starting in 5th grade and this show holds a special place in my heart. But I gotta say, there is nothing worst then a very important climax or battle arc getting interrupted by a stupid filler. It can be a complete turn off. Are some of them fun to go back and watch? yes! of course! but the timing of them is horribly off in my opinion and they can get lengthy and as you watch more of them you start getting angry and frustrated. "this is pointless" probably describes the feeling best to some of you. THE OVERALL: 9 in my personal enjoyment, 8 in terms of quality overall (as a critic) I have been watching for so many years now so it is really hard for me to critique this fairly. I hope for the most part you guys understand where Im coming from. Overall this anime is a great watch. Probably will be a classic when its all over, but that will be along time from now. Im extremely jealous of anyone just starting the series now because you get to skip all those fillers. But yeah, please watch it, it only gets better as you watch and the more you watch the more you wont be able to stop. Most deadly jutsu? Flashback no Justu hands-down. This jutsu can easily can rip anyones mind to shreds, destroy someones sanity, or worse.....make them turn off the computer/TV in a matter of seconds :0 .....deadly

Ok to start with naruto this is one of the first anime that i had ever watched when i was a kid. Naruto is the type of anime that has good character storiesx due to its long run and has a decent story in which usually doesnt stale in my eyes atleast. I really enjoy naruto definetly one of favorites but it does have alot of flaws. First of all the art style tends to change just recently in the story the art style changed from what it was before its not a big change but its still there. Second HUGE flaw about this series is the constant filler in this anime we will get around 3 episodes of cannon and then get thrown into flashbacks and even sometimes it will takes months off of the story to show us a full filler arc and the amount that it happens makes watching very boring but they do make up for it when the story usually resumes. Another thing that can sometimes be wierd is the animation it can be good and it can also be at a stand still and just freeze at times. In my opinion Naruto is a good show to watch its a 10/10 in my book just because of my connection but for the average person a good 8/10 sounds about right give it a watch if you like long running shows. Sincerely, The Anime Gods

I'll be honest: I didn't like Naruto that much. Now before you think I've gone nuts, hear me out. I liked the premise of the story and I enjoyed the beginning of the series quite a lot as well. The sound track is pretty nice, albeit a little dramatic at times and I liked the animation. I liked most of the characters, even. But there were a few things that really killed the series for me. One issue was that there were way too many fillers. Even die-hard Naruto fans will agree with me on this. There were so many just useless episodes about random missions or life at Konoha or whatever, that I started to get sick of watching. Some of them were nice, I'll admit, but most of them added basically nothing to the story line and got on my nerves. Out of the 500 episodes of Naruto, at least 100 are fillers and for me, that is just waaay too many. There was also an issue of a few plot holes and good ideas that were not revisited at all, which got me mildly to thoroughly irritated from time to time based on how interested I was in the idea. But in the long run, I don't think that problem alone would have made me dislike the series as much as I do. This next one is kind of personal preference. Although Naruto doesn't have a bunch of blatant fan service or girls in bikinis and whatnot. I eventually got sick of the fact that almost every new female character was introduced with an obligatory butt shot or boob shot. For some of them it was more odd and out-of-place than the others, but overall I'd say that the idea just kind of got old. Fan service in general isn't really my thing, but I don't mind it that much if it doesn't become a central part of the story. Once again, however, this is just personal preference, so if you like fan service or don't find butt/boob shots boring, this won't bother you at all. But the biggest issue I had was the Sharingan (an eye that grants the user access to special techniques). In the beginning, I really liked the idea of an eye that can copy other jutsu (ninja techniques that are somewhat like magic, but marginally explained) instantaneously. It was an interesting idea and I looked forward to its uses and how it would be developed. I expected there to be some kind of upgrade to it. So when Itachi (one of the characters) showed up with a Mangekyo Sharingan that was very useful to for genjustu (marginally explained mind control), I accepted it. I didn't really get how someone could get from a copying eye to any eye that can hypnotize people, but I just kind of shrugged and went with it. But when Sasuke (one of the main characters) and Itachi started to yank literal skeleton monsters out of their eyeballs, I got super irritated. Explain to me how in the world we got from a copying eye to an eye that has enough room to fit a skeleton. At this point the writer was blatantly just adding complete bs to the Sharingan in order to make Sasuke look more "badass". Sure, it made him look marginally more competent, but to me, it was just irritating. It made no sense in any way, shape, or form and was just a major plot hole and turnoff. The final nail in the coffin was when a villain with the Sharingan showed up with a dimension in his eyeball. How? Just how? You're really telling me that there is now a special dimension accessible to Sharingan users that no one had any prior knowledge/ idea about? What does the main ability of the Sharingan, the copy cat eye, have to do with pulling dimensions out of thin air? It was like the writer was trying to see how far he could go with just random, unexplained power ups to the Sharingan. It was infuriating, stupid, and I lost what little respect and awe I had for the Sharingan I had with this "new ability". The entire constant evolution issue with the Sharingan was even further offset and outlined by the Byakagan (another eye that gives the person access to special justu). The Byakagan was established as very strong and blatantly more powerful than the Sharingan at the beginning of the series. So when I noticed that the Sharingan was turning into some kind of a monster, God-like eye, I expected some sort of special Byakagan to form. But the Byakagan stayed completely the same from episode 1 to episode 500. If you're going to power up one eye so much, at least stay consist and do something to the other one! Overall, some parts of the story were done really well. Some aspects of the plot and some of the messages wrapped up in this story are good. But some things in the story just completely killed it for me and even though I watched the entire series, I kind of wish I had just dropped it once the problems became too much for me to handle. Even so, a lot of people like Naruto and there is nothing wrong with that. I just listed what issues made Naruto a no-go for me. So if you have read the plot summary and don't have any issues with the problems I outlined above, go for it! Hopefully you will enjoy Naruto more that I did.

Anime with the best ninja story concept ever. I watched Naruto anime since I was in junior high school. This anime is very popular in Indonesia. All anime lovers in Indonesia, must know about Naruto. An anime about epic ninja fights, and entertaining ninja adventures, as well as a harsh ninja world. An anime that tells about Uzumaki Natuto, who wants to become Hokage, and become a great ninja, who is relied on by many people. This anime is good, but there are things I don't like. Too many non-canon filler stories, and too many flashbacks, which doesn't really matter.

Hmmm what can I say about Naruto? Well, for having a total of 500 epsidoes 204 of these are fillers (This is 41% of the anime). This is a bit annoying because it did drag out some of the scenes, which I found a bit unnecessary. I think filler episodes break up the flow of the anime and makes me confused about what's happening when they finally end and go back to the main story. However, the anime was really fun to watch. The anime had the right amount of comedy and angst when needed. Overall, the anime displayed good character development (for some of the characters at least), I just wished that it had less filler episodes, but it's to be expected with an anime this big.

Brief overview: A Shonen series that is set in a ninja world with a massive amount of flashbacks. This review will be based on the whole Naruto series from the beginning to the last movie. Boruto will be excluded. Introduction Set's straight after the last Arc of Naruto where Orochimaru takes Sasuke hostage. Meanwhile, Naruto is on a mission to save his close friend Sasuke and get stronger to become a Hokage at the same time. Story 7/10 For most Shonen series the genre always primarily focuses on the identity of what the anime is known for from the beginning. Bleach and Naruto is an action and adventure series where Demon Slayer and Hero Academia are similar but have added romance within it. Naruto sets its identity well at the start especially the romance chart however, as the series progresses it leans more towards telling a deeper story and the romance chart becomes more or less a mess within the characters. The main story is great, but they implemented so many flashbacks towards the original Naruto as fillers throughout the series. It is unnecessary to add so many flashbacks from the original Naruto as we already have witnessed it from the beginning to the end. A good flashback would be outside of the original Naruto such as Hashirama's time period as it tells how the hidden leaf is built or a small flashback that talks about how Hinata fell in love with Naruto. What ruins this series is the romance. The story is trying to incorporate the romance genre into the series which it limits the world content we get to see as the story already has tons of flashbacks and the romance genre doesn't fit into Naruto. This is because it makes the series look like another typical school romance drama which it does not fit into the action, emotional, and rich story world of Naruto. Generally, it's a great story but with so many flashbacks and character narrative, it limits the world we get to see in Naruto such as the Samurai's, Hidden Mist Village, and Iwagakure. Even if they show other villages and places it is not much and it feels/looks more or less the same as all other places that Naruto has visited. The most strangest thing is that they incorporated so much unnecessary modern technology into the world of Naruto such as that fucken ninja using a world war 2 radioman to operate during combat when they already have one of the mind-jutsu that lets one of them communicate through all other Ninjas mindset. I won't be surprised that they would use fucking Gun's in Naruto maybe AK47-jutsu next. Characters 7/10 The characters is definitely well-written but the problem with the characters is that each character's relationship doesn't fit well with the other characters. I give you an example throughout the series they keep trying to say that Sasuke is basically like a brother to Naruto and Naruto is trying to get him back to the good side. Now everything is well written but truthfully Sasuke and Naruto don't work well compared to Naruto and Gaara. If you take a step back and look at it. Both of them understand the same pain and suffering from their childhood when they first met no one understands what Gaara is talking about however Naruto is the only one there that totally understands him because he knows that type of pain and loneliness while Sasuke does not fit in because he already had a family from the start while both of them don't. Another problem is Sasuke and Sakura. Throughout the series, they keep implying that despite all the evilness that Sasuke has done Sakura, still loves him even towards the very end. However, most of the time the relationship between Sakura and Naruto is deeper than Sasuke and Sakura if you look at it. Naruto was there when the Hidden Leaf was about to get destroyed and he was also there during the great ninja war. Both Naruto and Sakura share a very powerful bond with each other as both of them witness catastrophic destruction multiple times. Yes, Hinata was there at the same time but it's only for a brief moment compared to Sakura and Naruto. This is why romance does not fit into this series when the author is trying to make everyone fell in love instead most of the intended characters have barely any relationship development at all. Another problem is the Hierarchy system of Naruto. In the series within a village, the Hokage is usually the strongest one however, during Tsunade's reign most of the time there is so many other candidates that is stronger or at least have more knowledge than Tsunade. A couple of examples would Kakashi, Guy and most importantly Danzo. Aside from all that Naruto is portrayed very well within the Series because if you look at it Naruto was never the strongest or the smartest character within the series. He makes mistakes and those mistakes are learning experiences to make him into a great person which those mistakes gain him trust and allies who share the pain with him within the series. Animation 5/10 The animation suffers the same thing as One Piece it is a coin-flipping type of animation. However, I have never seen anything that is so well-animated yet bad at the same time. One perfect example is the fight with Pain. They drew the fps well but fuck if you look at the face it looks abysmally bad towards the point that is funny. Otherwise, the animation is not bad for the most part but there is time to time when some parts is poorly animated and times when the animation that looks goot yet bad at the same time. TLDR It's not a bad story if you can ignore the massive amount of flashbacks and the ridiculous modern technology that is used in the ninja world. The characters are good but matched towards the wrong characters when they should've been matched towards the character that understands them the most and the animation is a coin-flipping quality where sometimes the animation can look good yet bad at the same time.

Naruto Shippuden : The first 300 episodes are clearly nothing compaired to the rest. The last 200 are what made Naruto so good, they are the reason why everyone love Naruto. The sound, the animation, the story, everything is awesome. But there is one thing that bothers me. The ending. It could've been 1000 times better... In my opinion, it should have stopped when Sasuke and Naruto are lying on the ground after the final fight. After that, everything feels like non canon episode. All the hype was gone, and Naruto didn't even become the hokage. Also, the art and animation was batched. Other than that, I am glad that I watched this anime, it really affected me.

This series has disappointed me greatly in multiple ways, the main cases being how it destroys the core aspects of the series themes and how most of the loved side characters were handled poorly in execution and many established characters ended forgettable. There are other things such as the pacing being off in some arcs and inconsistent world building however, I would like to finish this review on a positive note and say that the actual production quality in regards to art and audio was generally done well. In conclusion: Shippuden hasn't succeeded in surpassing the original Has glaring problems that are overlooked Is overall a 6/10

I enjoyed watching this anime from the beginning when he was younger trying to prove himself and also when he came back as an adult. The only problem was that now the story seems like it is slowing down. It is taking them 2 months just to show 1 fight scene. Other than that I love this anime.

Naruto is a tricky one for me. I absolutely adore the manga, I'm still reading it and I was really excited when I heard that the Naruto Shippuden was coming! The first 30-40 episodes were alright...not great, but they weren't terrible. After that, there were just too many fillers, strayed quite a bit from the manga and I just dropped it. Also, I believe the anime just kind of got cheesy and the art wasn't as great either. So, overall, I give Naruto Shippuden a 8/10 because of the manga. The art is great, story is great, no fillers...but the Naruto Shippuden anime just gave Naruto a bad name in my opinion. My recommendation: if you want to start reading Naruto or gave up on it, don't watch the anime! Read the manga, you won't be disappointed :) .

500 episodes ------- 7.9 / 10 Hailed as a classic, hated as never before: Naruto Shippuden. It clearly suffers from its overuse of fillers. Even so, it still maintains an interesting narrative bringing action, comedy and drama together until its conclusion. Definitely a classic that has affected world culture and will continue to affect it over the years. Watching after the hype I must say: It is a decent and very fun anime. The good: -It has a good world building. -well developed in terms of characters. - Animation doesn't bother so much. - Good sound design and soundtrack. The bad: - Fillers kill the pacing, especially at the final arc. - Animation mistakes happen often. - Sound is worse than in comparasion with the classic version Overvall a fun show to watch after the hype.

Naruto Shipppuuden has a spectacular story with well built characters. I am not only talking about the main characters, but also secondary characters and especially the villains. Not to mention that it has the best fighting animations ever seen. Not only the animation at technical level but the own choreography and strategies of the fight according to each individual and its power. The story has many ramifications and variants, which despite one and another plot hole (which is understandable because of the extended time of its development) every each character evolve and go through a growth and development of character. Naruto is that character that we can understand and we want to be like him. We see his growth, it is not a character of 2 dimensions, but of 3 or 4. The same happens with many others, and the most fascinating are the villains. Especially those from Akatsuki. For me, Pain is one of the best-built villains I've seen so far in anime and even in movies. I quoted this anime on my master's thesis countless times, exactly because of its story and character construction, and also because of its animations and fight choreography. Anyone who loves a good fight (choreographically and visually) will feel immense satisfaction in this anime. Just like anyone who likes a good story with good heroes and good villains, both quite human. They do not make the characters just the flawless hero or the inhuman villain. No. The characters have a reason that moves them, because of their life experiences. I strongly advise. My favorite anime, no doubt.

After the original Naruto series the quality of the story diminishes greatly. Mostly because Naruto's popularity made the corporate control over the series much more involved, thus skewing the story to fit polling, and also the narrative got really convoluted just in terms of enemies and power ups and this and that. I'd still recommend watching this just because some parts of the story are worth knowing! If you've seen the og Naruto, seeing Naruto pursue Sasuke, and Sasuke's bid for power and search for the truth are something you want to see unravel. Lot's of really cool fights in this series. Can get really monotonous though, especially if you watch fillers. Not to spoil anything, but if you are excited for character development, expect to see the opposite in some cases, you will probably be disappointed if you are really looking into the show. If not, then enjoy it for what it is!

Naruto is my favourite Anime of all time it is because of Naruto that i like anime as ,much a si do now so with that said this review is going to nbe very biased but its my review so i can do what i want ;) This show has far surpassed my expectations of the first series.The storyline is so informative and powerful there's nothing you won't understand if you watch every episode accordingly.I love that all the characters have grown and the action is even more defined and EPIC!This has made DBZ look terrible in comparison.The story can make you laugh,cry,get angry at the bad guys and more.The one thing I do dislike is that they re-show the same parts over and over again in flashbacks but since they do add other sides to the story we already know it makes up for it. If you're a anime junky that is only satisfied by great action and a strong storyline look no further here it is! before watching Shippuden it is a MUST to watch part 1 but honestly if you havne't watched Naruto yet and are feeling put off by the filler sand what you have heard online then all i can say is give it a watch and let me know how you feel once you finish it.

NB: Recommended to watch Naruto before Shippuden. Because this is a continuation if did not know :) Naruto has been out for years for as long as I know but I never intended to watch it. Everywhere I go and talk with people about anime they will know about Naruto, both those who watches anime and those who dont. My thoughts were quite ignorant and I judged it for being overrated and being popular because its a long watching series, thats all. Until last summer where I binge-watched this B*cth within 2-3weeks. And I can swear to you, it was a beautiful journey where I felt so sad that it ended. I regret somehow, and even wish I tried it earlier. No sugarcoating! Dont let the earlier episodes animation lure you to drop out because the quality is a little low, if you compare it to those high quality anime series NOW. Ok enough rambling about how good it makes me feel :) The good: Story 10: The more you watch it the better and better it will be. No point in this series where the excitment, storyline, and pace drops down. Even at the begnning was already very good. I cant believe the author made this story where all the stuff connected to each other and gave meaning without being forced. I myself believe there is no plotholes, only amazing writing and how the characters interwines with the story so much. Character 9: Sooo many amazing character with deep and amazing background. You will get the feels and sadness for them, even though you have not seen much of them. Cool, cute, amazing made characters in this series, where you will enjoy the good and bad characters. The reason for why I gave it a 9 instead of 10 is because when most of them are that amazing, those with a little less character or personality, with background will fall down the list very low. You might even dislike som of them cause they feel so useless compare to the others character you know or like. Sound 10: The voice acting here is top notch, all of them are suitable for their character. And I love the way whenever they call out for their jutsu. The music in here is legendary for me. From epic, emotional, sadness and sorrow to happiness or the feeling of nostaliga. Beautiful made and brings out the act of the very scene very well. You are gonna be a fan of the music even when you have not watch naruto yet. Art 9: When I give the art 9/10 I am being a little bias here, cause sometimes you can notice the quality is not always top notch or even that good. Sometimes its amazing animation and quality. Other times you can notice the difference of this epiosde and that ep, thats the problem, when Im nitpicking. And the earlier episodes have not that great art if you compare it to the later episodes. Of couse it should be understandable since its older, so its a good thing that there is improvement. The bad: Nothing is perfect and I tell even my most favorite anime is not. Naruto has it flaws and that is the the bad thing. Lets call out for those jutsus 1. Filler jutsu, as fans calls it. Naruto its quite well known for being the king of it. And the amount of it is massive, thats a whopping 44% filler, if I have not recalled it wrong. Some of it was nice to have, but sometimes its downright cruel when you are in the middle of something big and they take you on for a 30 eps journey of filler. Good thiing its finished so you can just skip over those, I recommend to watch some of it though, if you are a hardcore fan. 2. Flashback jutsu. The use of flashback in here sometimes brings out tears of sadness and feels that hits you right in the face. But on other occasions when they show you the flashback of something so many times, it will lose it purpose. I think that was the shame of it on smaller occasions. Other times when flashback is used because the producers are perhaps scared that the viewers have forgotten scenes that they have watched for some episodes back or the ones you JUST WATCHED. And they show you the characters remembering the memories, the bad thing in this is that it has happened before where the character uses A WHOLE EP for that purpose. Thats enough complaining. Overall 10: I mean overall this was a wonderful anime, and I want to share this happiness and joy to as many as I could. I recommend this to be watched in your lfetime, and its strongly recommended by a very picky person. Pardon me if there are some grammar mistakes :) Do take me serious though :D

I'll try to keep this short: If you skip most of the fillers (not all), the anime is pretty good. It's one of those animes that grow on you over time, and it's all worth it when you watch the final episodes as if you went on the journey with Naruto, watched him grow from a nobody to one of the strongest people to exist in the universe. The music is really good and well used. It never changes from the original and it's used perfectly. Naruto has the best Anime plot I've ever watched. There are many characters and you will definitely find one to relate too. Most of the female characters are hard to like and some don't get enough screentime. If you're willing to take the journey, I assure you you won't regret it.

Apart from the war arc and ending this is a great anime. Unfortunately the series ended up being milked at the end for money. Masashi Kishimoto's brother Seishi's o-parts hunter also had a war arc but it was done a lot better than what's in naruto. Yes the war arc has some exciting moments but it lacked a distinct purpose (and there are other parts that have you scratching your head wondering "does that make sense"). It's pretty disappointing that kishi dropped the ball on the end because i think naruto could have continued developing characters. The fights going from more hand to hand to dragon ball level attacks didn't feel natural

This anime is very emotional and can get both women & men to shed tears routinely. It has some of the best music of any anime. The fighting is masterful involving different types including physical - taijutsu, mental - genjutsu and supernatural - ninjutsu all beautifully choreographed. It has some of the best fights ever in anime like the mystery coffin man vs the Shinobi Alliance. But the best part is this anime has some of the best plot twists in anime history. At times you will feel like this anime lied to you for the longest time but you will eventually love it when the truth is revealed. Everything about this anime is top notch from the story telling to the music to character development of both minor and major characters. Just be sure to look up which episodes are fillers and skip them altogether to best experience this anime.

Both series of Naruto were in my opinion unenjoyable, at its worst the anime is inconsistent with animation, plethora of poorly written characters and poor pacing with things like 6 mins of recap footage, cutaways to backstories and flashbacks not necessary to whats going on, and actual interesting characters in the original series that I liked ended up becoming background characters being replaced for even worse written characters. With the 700 episodes of Naruto you could better spend ur time watching 30 smaller 12 episode anime. At its best Naruto is full of unique design, amazing fight scenes and creative fighting styles and techniques, and interesting character dynamics developing one of the most iconic rivalries in anime history. Although I did not take the time to watch all 700 episodes I would not recommend anyone this anime

I feel like the ONLY reason this show received so many lower ratings was cause of it's fillers. I don't really blame that entirely on the show with all the studio management, catching up with manga etc. etc. I'm gonna rate this show at the core of it's story. And the Core story, is pretty much second to none. If you are willing to watch all the episodes of this series, which I know is alot, then it is damn worth it. The Story is So Grand, So Emotional, attacks the viewers in a deep and moral level, and so hype/exciting that I just can't get enough of this story and I'll be sad the day this show ends for sure. Aside from the filler episodes, I love everything about this anime.

Naruto Shippuuden is a very average anime considering it's vast popularity and will make you wonder why it is so popular. Most people who are watching this or is planning to watch this has seen the previous series. I will warn you now with the exception of Naruto chasing after Sasuke and the female characters still being completely useless please forget everything you think you know about Naruto because it is buried one way or another. Story 7: It manages to keep you in suspense, but sometimes becomes too dark for fans of the lighter Naruto. Art 6: The art is still average. Nothing special. Sound 5: Beware voice actors and tunes that don't fit with a scene. Character 7: Some characters changed drastically, most stayed the same. Some characters are cliche. Enjoyment 7: I'm still watching it so I like it overall. The series pick up from Naruto two years later and we see how much our heroes grown changing the mood to a darker more mature tone. Part of the reason people stay tuned to Naruto was because of the light and refreshing tone so for it to be almost completely gone puzzles me. It makes me miss the plot line of the old Naruto. As for fillers, whether you like it or not fillers need to be use in long anime series so the mangaka can have time to write more. Still I guess the complaining of fans worked because there has been less filler use in the series. The problem is because there has been less filler use the pacing of the show has suffered. Some fights scenes are ridiculously long and constant repeat of the same flashback is the new norm.Even the camera shots are repetitive and unnecessary. For example in one episode with a reunion like air every five seconds you see the face of a character. It gets infuriating at times. Naruto has always been average with their art and this time is no exception. Expect the same overall look with the occasional darker backgrounds to draw more suspense. Also the characters look mostly the same with just a change of their outfit. Since this series is darker than the original Naruto so is the music. Even when it is supposed to be a funny moment sometimes the same dark melody will still play. The openings and endings are mostly mediocre, but if you want to check them out then do so! To me the dark tone of music sets the mood, but is overplayed to the point it does not stand out. Background music blends, but also makes the emotion of the scene stand out and Naruto Shippuuden falls to do that. Also it took me a while to get used to the voice actors. I know the characters have changed, but it's only been two years! Naruto's voice in the sub version sounds like a 30 year old man! When I watched Naruto I watched it in dub and I liked how their voices(even if it was annoying) matched the age of the character and was unique. Many characters in this series voice has the monotone base that never changes making the character boring. Now the moment most people have been waiting for in this review, the characters. "Do Hinta and Naruto get together?" "Who becomes the 6th hokage?" Well I'm sorry I won't be answering those questions, watch it for yourself. Naruto probably changed more than any other character in Naruto Shippuden. No longer is Naruto the repulsive ninja who acts before he thinks, no longer is he immature. The failure of getting Sasuke back and the training with Jiraya molded the Naruto we knew into a man. He is not even naive anymore. Sure chasing after a friend who doesn't want to be saved is naive in a way, but to me is shows his loyalty more. Sakura may have become a medical ninjia and strong like tsunade, but she is still useless like almost every girl in this series. As for Sasuke, if you still liked him after watching Naruto, well you won't now. Sasuke gets so annoying in this Naruto Shippuden it makes no sense. Sometimes you would wish anyone would kill him. Besides old time favorites you get a new set of characters plus a more detailed background of some minor ones like Kakashi. Still the characters are a little cliched. Overall I still enjoyed Naruto. It's funny considering at first I was totally against watching the new series, but life changes you sometimes. I would definitely recommend this to fans of the ninja genre! If this review was helpful I am glad I helped you and if it was not well I hope my next review helps you.

The beginning of this show starts off great, ill give it a 8 or 9 for the first few hundred episodes. However the show should of ended over a year ago. They had 3-6 episodes left to air as the manga was over and done with. Almost as if they are expecting the show to continue they have been adding fillers, For the most part its 1 drawn out episode then 4-10 filler episodes. The story is great, but the fillers are not, it has became a joke of several of the communities. I do recommend that you watch it, but follow the suggestions of the communities on what episodes to skip. Good story and better artwork then the original, character development was a little bland but expected. Great sequel bad fillers.

I'm not using that sectioned up rating system because that's bullshit. I'm also not gonna follow all those rules on the right either so there will probably be spoilers in here. I'll write my review my way thanks guys. This is going in my blogs as well. Something's gotta go there! But oh god, where to begin? I guess with a bit of background. I started watching Shippuden back in the early years of high school when my then friends introduced me to it. The original Naruto was my first ever anime and I watched it in english dub. Naturally I wanted to keep it consistent when I moved onto Shippuden. As the years went on and I carried on keeping up with it, the dub suddenly stopped, but the story hadn't finished. I realised I had to wait. But I didn't want to watch it as it was airing, there were huge gaps between episode releases and even without them I'd struggle to keep track of the entire story for that long. So I gave up. And now, years after the fact, I finished high school, I've just finished college and I notice by chance that Naruto Shippuden's english dub is also finished. So I buckled down and decided to watch in full the thing that has haunted me for 5 years. And hoo boy, that was a journey. Overall, upon reflection the show feels like 480 episodes of meh with some great bits sprinkled in, followed by a final 20 episodes that might as well be a completely different show, they're so good. My biggest problem with the show is, you guessed it, filler. I must've skipped over 100 episodes worth of stuff, from whole episodes I didn't care about, like all those undead dudes we've never seen before but we get a full episode long flashback about them, or the never ending reuse of old scenes to fill space in an episode. When an episode didn't feature a single flashback, it was a mercy. There is one exception though. Paradise Life on a Boat. The arc is entirely filler, but it's also the best arc in the whole show, besides the epilogues. It finally lets up the dull seriousness for a while and let's us have some fun. Naruto's shadow clones staging a revolt, mushrooms of death, these are some of the best episodes of the entire show, and they have nothing to do with the story whatsoever. I don't really have a good segway into this next bit, but let's talk about the characters. I... don't hate Sakura... or Sasuke or Naruto or anyone really. Kaguya's a bit one-note, but gods usually are. I feel sorry for Sakura in particular. She's a great character but she's never allowed to do anything. She keeps saying to herself that she's gonna stand toe to toe with Naruto and Sasuke, but she never does. In the final boss, she does brief support for Obito and then gets one punch in right at the end. Poor girl. And Sasuke oooo, he pissed me off for a good while but, after seeing his final battle with Naruto, I kind of get it. He's been so wrapped up in hate and revenge his whole life he can't comprehend forgiveness even when it's right in front of him, and it takes Naruto literally beating some sense into him that he's finally able to admit to himself that he doesn't want to sever his ties. That's some damn good character writing and I praise Kishimoto for creating an arc this complex for a character he didn't even want to make originally. I was never fully sold on the relationships though. Most of the time I felt that Sakura could do so much better than Sasuke, and I didn't really believe the love between Naruto and Hinata, because they hardly ever interacted in the show. They needed to add in another movie right after the ending but before the epilogues to add some much needed depth to their relationship before dropping the wedding on us. Same problem with Ino and Sai too, but those two were more in the background so I don't really mind that they only interacted once in the entire show (that I watched) before that point. Besides, Ino is like the personification of sex appeal to me (remember, I first watched this show when I was going though puberty) so I'm automatically on board with anything she does (or anyone). Feel bad for Tenten though. I really like her and she even admits in the epilogues that she's spent so much time training and never takes time for herself. I wonder who'd be a good match for her. Maybe Omoi? He was fun. Also, the Akatsuki. In particular, Pain and Konan, because I love Pain's character design so much, and Konan because she's an underappreciated badass. Also Deidara because of his fun personality, and the fact that's he's voiced by Sonic the Hedgehog. I'm glad I waited for the dub. I tend to get really anal when I have to switch between dub and sub, especially when it's a show I care about, but it turned out to be a blessing in disguise. Maile Flanagan will always be Naruto to me, as will everyone else. Dave Wittenberg is inseparable from Kakashi in my head and Neil Kaplan was a brilliantly threatening Madara/Tobi, just to name a few. In the end, Shippuden kinda feels like a series of peaks and valleys. The highs are super high, the lows are scarily low and there's basically nothing in between. I hate parts of it and I love other parts, especially the well animated parts. Naruto vs Sasuke is one of the most brilliant and emotional fight scenes I've ever had the pleasure of witnessing, and I'm glad I waited till I was 19 so I can fully appreciate it. There were only four moments in this show that made me cry. One was, what you just read, Naruto vs Sasuke when Sasuke is finally able to admit to himself that he wants friends. The other was near the beginning where Gaara is brought back to life and he's surrounded by the comrades he thought hated him, and the third and fourth were Naruto saying goodbye to his parents. Those were some of my favourite moments of the story, and I will never forget them. Aaaaannnnd, I think that's about it. I've gotten my thoughts out, something that's been 5 years in the making. I love this show, and I hate it at the same time. I'm probably not gonna watch Boruto until the dub finishes, so get back to me in 2029. Maybe I'll have gotten over my joint crush on Ino and Tenten by then. Going through it, I figured I'd end up disappointed, like, 5 years of waiting for a 4/10, but thank god they saved it. If you want to watch Shippuden, watch it with a guide. This show is notorious for taking way too long to say not very much, so chop it down wherever you can. I skipped as much as possible but it still took me two months to finish. Or, if you watch nothing else of Shippuden, watch the epilogues, they're like Shippuden god mode and are better than all 480 episodes before them put together. The only question left is, after all that, what the fuck am I gonna do now? It's all over, I can move on with my life. fuck

Well, if I say Naruto, every one knows what thats mean, fillers, good characters, a story of a lifespan, ninjas etc. So let me rate them one by one. First, the fillers. There are a lot of fillers in Sjippuuden, and some of them are too long to tear apart the exciting actions at the main story line. But, and thats a very big "but" I enjoyed all of them, it widened the univers, deepened the characters, get you more excited for the main parts or they were simply funny. And one of them actually hits, someone's face reveal (a photographer camuflaged man), I waited 8 years to see that face! Ninjas. They use chacra to empower their special jutsus. Chacra: It is a recycling type energy that flows in everything, if you use it, you have to "heal" it back with resting/meditating. Chacra is also working as the internet, it connects everithing with everything, can transport information, even matter. And in the end you will actually realise that Naruto is sci-fi. There are a lot of characters you will know in Naruto, and all of them develops through the entire series. So if you want a fantasy/adventure like sci-fi anime with some hundred episodes full of emotion and characteristics you will get it from Naruto Shippuuden! J-score: ★★★★★

Who would have thought that probably the biggest anime franchise in existence would be one of the best? I came into Naruto at the recommendation (or rather pleading) of my brother. This was when I was 12 but I soon dropped it because I couldn't deal with all of the pain and heartbreak that our blond protagonist had to go through. Years passed and this show was always at the back of my mind, I knew I would have to watch it again all the way through this time. Completely by chance, I chose to start it very soon after the main story line ended, i.e. the final (really final) battle between Naruto and Sasuke. As I watched the first series, I was a bit disappointed in the lack of epic battles that I had become accustomed to with shows like Bleach and Hunter x Hunter. But then came shippuden, and boy oh boy did that change. Not only did I get my wish of totally insane fights but I also got a much more emotionally mature series. To be sure, the original has a lot of pain, but they really explored it in shippuden. When all is said and all is done, Naruto really stands out as a series that gives hope for humanity and for yourself. Note that what follows is solely based on the main story arc, I am not considering the story/art/sound/characters/enjoyment of fillers. Story - 9: Really phenomenal. There are very few points where I feel like the story is forced, the reasons for the characters' actions are sound. Though the last bit with "who was /really/ behind the whole thing" seemed a little convoluted. The story is really driven by the characters, who are also phenomenal. Art - 9: Naruto Shippuden takes a more modern approach to art than its predecessor did. This is to be expected as the whole series has been going on for about 15 years. The new art style fits the more solemn feel of the series, even though there are points of awkwardness. Sound - 9: The new series brings along a new and improved soundtrack. The new songs are great but aren't outstanding. Characters - 8: They are truly amazing, though many of the women are a bit underdeveloped. It has certainly improved since the first series, but alas, you don't always get what you want. Despite this, the characters really drive the story forward with their lifelike traits. Enjoyment - 10: It is truly an amazing show with truly amazing characters and storylines. Though there are flaws, they are overshadowed by the enormous amount of positivity this show produces. Really, this show will make you an optimist. Overall - 9: Naruto is really an iconic story which deserves recognition, sure, it probably reminds you of when you were a weeb. And yes there are a TON of fillers (but in this day and age, one quick google search can tell you which episodes are fillers, so just avoid them), but Naruto Shippuden (and more broadly the Naruto franchise) is among the best stories of all time.

Naruto and consequently Naruto Shippuuden were the first set of anime I ever watched, and overall I am thankful for that. It helped give me a strong baseline for comparing other anime to. Naruto Shippuuden is a continuation of the story of Naruto, a boy ninja in a world called Earth, split into 5 countries, each representing a different element, fire, water, etc. He has grown up a bit from the first Naruto series, after training with a legendary ninja of his Fire country in the interim, and is still interested in furthering his relationship with his brother-in-arms, Sasuke. The story-line, outside of the fillers, is interesting if not a bit predictable, the characters are varied and likable, the music is pretty good, and the creativity behind the various ninja skills is awesome. The problem with Naruto Shippuuden, as was the case with the first Naruto series, is that it is riddled with too many filler episodes, regaling exploits and side-stories of forgettable characters and events. Very few filler episodes are worth watching in my opinion. Overall I'd say Shippudden is worth watching, but only if you have a filler list so that you may skip them.

Even with the filler episodes and with certain events being stretched out for what seems like forever, Naruto Shippuuden still manages to live up to it's reputation. This sequel manages to capture the childish tendencies of the previous installment while adding a new sense of meaningful plot and emotion. While the original series dabbled on this, Shippuuden takes it to a whole new level. This adds a whole new layer to the show, with loads of plot elements adding a new sense of maturity to the show, even if it still is very fun and childish. When it comes to the episodes of filler, while they can be annoying to watch, I believe this doesn't take away from the show. It is very tempting on the first watch to skip the fillers and have plot development. While I completely understand this feeling, I believe that this show shouldn't be dismissed as lesser because of how many filler episodes it has. Even when the plot is not being explored in these episodes, they still manage to be enjoyable even if they serve no purpose in the overall story. But even with this opinion, I understand the want for the story to continue. So if you are the kind of person who watches a show for plot development, maybe skip the filler episodes unless you want to see more of Naruto and his friends kicking some ass. Naruto is one of the series which completely deserves the hype around it. It has amazing characters and an amazing story, with plenty of enjoyment to be found in watching it. I highly recommend it to anyone interested.

I do not like this show one bit. Nuh uh. I already hated it once they started doing DBZ shit, because it's Naruto. Naruto is supposed to be ninjas. Instead he turns into fucking fox man McGee and becomes literal Jesus at the end of the series. That isn't what a ninja is. Ninjas are stealthy and cool, not spectacle fighting meatheads. Everything that I liked about the og series was just stripped away with this show. The only thing I liked about the story was the Akatsuki. They were great. Very entertaining, very interesting characters. Pain's arc was also good. I cannot stand the rest of it. If this isn't known by you, I don't skip filler. So I had to sit through all 500 fucking episodes of Shippuden and slowly want to carve my eyes out of their sockets for hours upon end until finally it was over. I'll get into art now. Art: The art is good. No real flaws and the Pain frames are memed too much. Character: Hoo boy. I don't like any of the main characters. Naruto is an imbecile who rarely convinces me to like him and Sasuke is the most whiny, bitch-ass, immature character ever. I don't expect them to be perfect, but at least make them develop. What was Sasuke's development? No, seriously. How the fuck did he develop? He didn't. Not at all. "He became less broody and immature over the course of the series." That's bullshit. What about him is mature at all? He's a stupid fucking child, through and through, for the entirety of the series. He isn't cool, he isn't fun, he's just whiny. Itachi is 10x better and I don't even like him that much. My favorite character is Jiraiya because he is somewhat interesting unlike the majority of the cast. But you know what they did with him? They fucking killed him. I get that you need to have the mentor die. But come the fuck on. Why then? Make him die in the war. Minato and Jiraiya coming together in the war arc would have been fantastic to see. Also why did Neji die? He didn't need to. That was a pointless death. It did nothing. Enjoyment: I hate this show. It's long for no reason, it doesn't adapt the manga well, I hate the characters, they stopped doing ninja shit, there are like 200 episodes of filler, Naruto and Sasuke never did and never will entertain me, and have I mentioned that I don't like this show?

My opinion: story 10/10 It made me cry several times,he was funny whenever he needed to,with a beautiful story animation 8/10 It was not the best but it also had very nice battles aesthetics-sound 9/10 constantly plays with your emotion,It has some things worth a listen and may sound a little funny but changes your view on some things in life (sorry for my English I do not know how to speak and write so well) Recommendations for Similar Series Fullmetal Alchemist : Brotherhood.............. Hunter X Hunter (2011)................ Bleach(2004) few words about the series (naruto,naruto shippuden) "Naruto is a boy who, on the day he was born, coincidentally had a giant demon fox spirit attack his village. Using a special kind of energy called chakra, a powerful individual sealed this demon fox inside of Naruto to protect the village. Naruto's parents however die in this attack, and he resorts to troublemaking for attention, as well as aspires to become the Hokage, the leader of the village, for people to acknowledge him. To do so, he must become a great ninja, someone who uses their chakra to perform special techniques, such as manipulating the elements to spit fireballs, raise walls of rock, blow gusts of wind that can slice through trees, manipulate the body, or create illusions and trick the opponent. The story of Naruto is about how he grows from a 12 year old low class weak ninja with his friends/classmates and their teachers, including his training to become stronger, personal struggles as well as the ones with the other villages, and fights with strong opponents. It also has his internal conflict with the demon inside of him as well as his attempts to be acknowledged by people as he grows in strength. It constantly has you wondering how things are going to turn out as strategy in combat is critical as they often fight enemies more powerful than they are, and must come up with the strategy to get ahead. Most people find themselves rooting for Naruto as they watch him do what seems impossible as due to his life as an orphan, as well has his overall complete lack of talent in all but a few specific things, has made him vow to NEVER give up, ever, and allows him to see the truth behind his opponents. Death is there for all sides, but it is not always the only solution because of Naruto.

Let's say you're looking for something to be your first anime and you like fighting, well naruto is your thing. This anime has it all there is a little romance there is some action there is character growth there is an interesting power system however the anime is very slow in a normal anime an Arc of naruto would be 12 episodes it is purposely extended to make viewers anticipate the next one more and more and want to watch the next episode. So back on topic naruto is for newbies because once you look naruto the other anime will seem a lot faster and be more to your interests i.e. the anime itself might be 5/10(personal opinion not a fan) however it's worth it for the consequences.

I am a manga reader and pierrot studio really did massive destruction to my favorite character. Now many people hated sakura because of what studio pierrot did to her. Not all anime watchers read manga like me. Stop damaging other characters for your own goal. I now have a great trust issue in every anime adaptation they release. I had to read the manga before watching it due to what they did to this series. I hate their production. The manga is so good to read and is so satisfying however the anime production is a huge disappointment for me.

Most people forget what Naruto is and what it is meant to be and start comparing it with anime that arrived a decade later. And it's almost impossible to assign numbers and evaluate a series like this one that has been running over a decade. Naruto was never a show made to compete with mind boggling story such as... I don't know let's say Cowboy Bebop for a lack of better example. But it was made in midst of a shounen revolution where the importance was placed on Friendship, goodness, and perseverance. Naruto is very little about ninjas. In fact it's very bad at portraying what ninjas are. But Naruto is creative at least. Taking this ninja genre and combining it into several martial and weapon arts to make this very unique show. Well unique is a bit subjective but whatever. I applaud the series for combining the natural elements, weapons, and even mixing human behaviors to create a world full of unique fighting techniques. Story wise, Naruto is about the character Naruto becoming the leader of his village. He is an orphan cursed with bearing a monster with him and the whole anime is about him overcoming the world of ninjas, which is filled with hatred and suspicion. See the series have some of the most fascinating characters. Each of them with their own background, although many of them could've been kept a secret for the better story progression and pacing. Many of these characters' actions are justified by their past and as the series progresses you can see how each of them changes and influences each other. However the best aspect of the series is also probably the worst aspect of it. While many main characters are given a good amount of attention and care and many of them are nurtured with logic, others just become fodder characters uttering 1 or 2 lines then their worth are never revisited again. The story of Naruto is about never giving up, making friends, and well, whatever standard shounens babble about. But Naruto is one of the few exceptions because Naruto is rarely a hypocrite and actually always stays around its core beliefs. As the series is ending, it's sad that many of the traits of the characters like Sasuke and Obito are reversing and villains are entering the infamous Dragon Ball complex (you enemy becomes bff lol), the main thing is Naruto remains Naruto: stupid and somehow still influential. After watching this series at different intervals and after watching other anime, I came to appreciate Naruto. Because I watched several long running shounen and nothing really even came close to the emotional appeal Naruto formed. I think I can safely say that this show truly keeps it promise and shows Naruto is a hardworking guy who becomes special. However, I still can't forgive this series for wasting the potential of so many characters, random power-ups, unnecessary glorification of Sasuke and Naruto (WE GET IT THEY'RE THE MAIN CHARACTERS) and Bleach-esque arse pulls. The fillers are downright horrible and let's not even explore the comedy. Seriously, many of the plot like Kaguya and other backstory could have been omitted, no they should have been omitted, to give Naruto a more refined ending but it is what it is. At the end of the day, Naruto is a good series about a guy never giving up as he faces challenge to save his friend and save his village. Indeed it is a tale of a gutsy ninja. Characters like Itachi, Jiraiya, and Pain are some of the noteworthy characters in all of anime. Naruto is a good series on what it stands for. Stop comparing it to high level, 13 episode series because all anime loses its lust after 500 episode mark. On a side note, this is not a proper review. Just whatever I feel about this series. I recommend it for the nostalgia and some really good fight scenes.

Do you like Hunter X Hunter and Full metal? Then please promtpy turn around and stay far away from the anime is shit-ru-to. People may tell you, "No, it's really good" or "It's really entertaining" but those same people would probably tell you "Manbuns are cool" or are addicted to minecraft. Watching this anime is like smoking cigarettes. I really wish I could quit, and they're terrible for me, and I can't smoke in public and it isn't as cool as I thought it was going to be, but fuck I just can't stop. I wish I had a nicotine patch for Naruto. A Naruto patch if you will. Let me break it down for you in a step by step. First start smoking: The beginning Yea, all your friends do it, and it looks cool, and that guy from the walking dead smokes and bitches love him right? Well yea, the show is pretty good when it starts off as far as plot goes. You think the plot is really cool, and it is. It's like a mustang gt shelby. You know you like Nissan GTR's more, and you know they are better cars, but there's nothing quite like a mustang. So you watch it, and you keep watching it, and you enjoy it. The effects haven't caught up to you yet. You're enjoying it. The animation is good, great even, and boy the fight scenes and new characters are fucking cool! I mean, deidara and sasori? These akatsuki are badass. oh & look there's itachi, and oh boy, sasuke is back! woah, naruto learns a new power? Woah, demon fights! The animation is kicking ass, the music soundtrack if fucking prime well known and skilled artists and the theme music is pretty good man. Full sails, and you're off. a year of smoking- The middle Okay, it's really not that cool anymore. People have started to tell you you're teeth are getting yellow, and your skin isn't as clear. Oh, and you always smell. And you can't smoke in your car, or in restaurants, and you gotta get up to go smoke and that pisses you off because you're friends are talking shit on you. That's now naruto. You're like, okay, the anime quality has gone down. The art is a bit doofy now, and the animation budget? Did you guys lose a lawsuit? Then there's the fillers. You're like, okay, I guess that one was okay but now this is the 5th one in like 60 episodes, wtf? Then the plot goes way off track and you're like, okay, well I guess it will just get better. So you keep smoking, and say "fuck all those people. I'll just hang out with smokers from now on". 2 years of smoking- The end Now you always reek, you can't hang around your nephew, and all your new friends are white trash and smoke newports, and you only smoke camels. You've given up hope, and the doctor says you need to cut back or else. Naruto is now garbage, and you know it is you piece of shit. The animation is laggier than a 1 legged prostitute, and the artwork has been handed over to 12th graders in a graphic design class from somewhere in Upstate Newyork. The plot is now on a different planet, and there's no fucking life there. Good luck finding water fuckhead. Now all your hope is in the music, the only good thing left, and in the remaining characters, which have dwindled down to a small ewok army on the shitty planet that is endor. You don't even enjoy it anymore, you just want it to end. You'll try quitting, but you remember the mange had cool fights and there was that one fight you wanted to see, so you're right back on it, smoking it up. Every episode is a cancer you wish would just explode. You pray for the end of the series with fierce determination that rivals that of a born again christian. Conclusion? I plead dear would be viewers. Don't you fucking dare watch this show. I don't care what your best friend said. Fuck him, he probably watches kill la kill and thinks it's really good and unique.

I don't even know where to begin. When I started watching the original Naruto it was great, tons of potential but once it hit shippuuden it didn't just go down hill, it flew down vertically with no stop in sight. It's depressing to see an anime with a lot of potential be destroyed. As it continues it looks like they are trying to squeeze out all the money possible out of this story instead of just ending it. Many people would disagree with me and a majority wont really give arguments other than being a fan boy but anyway here's my review. Story - Originally the story was supposed to be about a failure ninja who is hated by everyone because of the beast in him. He cries all the time, is extremely annoying to all his peers yet he still blames his beast for being hated. Anyway, the whole plot to this anime is to create bonds, friendships, and get acceptance with the title of "Hokage". In the first part of the Naruto series that's exactly what he worked to do and now with shippuuden everything changes, no more bonds, no more friendship, it's just an anime that resembles some sort of animal trade using tailed beasts. Naruto continues to chase sasuke and even after all the advantages hes born with he continues to not be able to catch him. Theres virtually no training in this anime at all, just free powers given over and over. Villains are just a line of people controlling one another. Art - Basic, Average, Modern, not unique. Most of the characters all look like they have been drawn using the same template. Just take off naruto's hair and eyes, throw in sasuke's hair and eyes, BOOM flawless. Sound - The music isn't anything special, usually its an asain man yelling what sounds like "SEA SAW" at you with background music. Characters - Not unique, very obvious copy of DBZ. naruto - Easily resembles goku, orange suit, blonde hair, raised by an old guy(hokage), both become monsters with a tail. Only difference is while naruto cried his whole childhood, goku lived alone with innocence. Sasuke - Very obvious copy of vegeta, from the hair, to the death of his whole race and getting revenge. Jiraya - Narutos, frog sage, old, perverted teacher, very similar to roshi, goku's turtle sage, old perverted teacher. Even the way naruto received training was similar, both asked for a large breasted hot girl. Enjoyment - At first it was enjoyable, now it makes you wanna rip your hair out at how ridiculous it is. Overall - 5/10 - and with good reason.

Naruto is the greatest anime I have watched to date. This anime is all about tragedy and triumph. For every tragedy there is a story of triumph, a story of an underdog overcoming their short-comings and becoming the hero. These tragedies brought me tears and the triumphs inspired me to do amazing things. Never before has anything played with my emotions more than Naruto. Every character has a tragic past, but in the end they are able to overcome their past and become a hero in one way or another. If anything the soundtrack is what tugged and my heartstrings the most. The way the OST was used in every situation made each episode more intense, dramatic or sad. I listen to this OST religiously and even to this day it still brings me to tears and reminds me of the hardships each character went through. I am sitting here struggling to find the words to explain how amazing this anime is but I still feel as if I am not doing Naruto any justice. The endless number of characters and jutsus still amazes me. With every episode there is something new, even the "fillers" that people tend to complain about. If you take the fillers seriously then you will learn things about the characters and gain a greater appreciation for them no doubt, especially the side characters. The depth that this series has is hard to grasp because of the numerous generations that this story is told over. The storyline covers centuries of shinobi and how each of their stories effects the next generation, I still have a tough time grasping this theory. Each decision made in Naruto effects the next, whether it is good or bad. Each character is likable in their own special way, even the so called "villains" of the show. I wish the anime/manga would never end. Naruto will always have a special place in my heart.

My First Review Here. English is not my main language so i may have some mistakes. First of all, the story of Naruto Shippuuden is not perfect and i give it 7 because of the fillers that were unnecessary but without them naruto would not be so popular and the memes around its fillers are amazing.There are some fillers that are good butt others are just so boring and uninteresting. Second, The Art I give it 6 because of Studio Perriot they fucked up a lot of the episodes with bad art and animation but instead they gave us a few rather 100+ episodes or so with good art and animation like episode 322 with Madara. Sound-8-Shippuuden has some of the best anime tracks.I think that a lot of people liked the sound/tracks of the naruto franchise. Characters-7 Team 7 as characters developed a lot through the series.The other characters also had a major development. I like that we can see how the characters change through the series from being a kid who does only trouble to a hero and a legend and most importantly Hokage that is Naruto. Enjoyment-9. Naruto had many amazing fights,sad scenes and funny moments but the fillers ruined a part of the story and the hype.If only the art and animation for some of the fights were better then it'd be perfect but nonetheless i liked every bit of it. Overall-9 I will never Forget Naruto because it was a part of my life for a long time and it will be in the future.Next is Boruto I hope that it'll be as good as Naruto or better. Believe IT! :D
